thinking.disposable_income: Lazybrook/Timbergrove is an upper-middle-income neighborhood with median household income around $100,000, indicating relatively high disposable income and ability to absorb transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending power and tend to prioritize quality of life, with many households able to afford multiple vehicles and regular retail/dining expenses.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has good car accessibility to major roads but limited transit options, with most residents (85%+) commuting by car and having above-average commute times to employment centers.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high car dependency, prioritize proposals that reduce car travel time while keeping driving fees moderate 2) Higher sales tax is acceptable given disposable income levels 3) Transit improvements are secondary but valuable for workforce access 4) Balance between reduced congestion and cost increases 5) Selected proposals that maintain reasonable transit fares for service workers while focusing on car travel time reduction
